Name: Avinoleum Footsteps
Description: An elderly hermit is writing his memoirs by the seminary ruins. He would like some images of Avinoleum.
QuestDesc: An elderly hermit is writing his memoirs by the seminary ruins. He would like some images of Avinoleum.

Conditions.PreQuestName: The Maiden, The Defier, The Death Crier

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excuse me, {Male=sir;Female=madam}, have you noticed something unusual in that sky?

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, just an old habit of mine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once, Avinoleum was a marvel admired across all of Rinascita. But now, it's nothing more than an expanse of shadows, hanging in the sky.

Options.PlotLineKey: Actually, I just returned from there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? How did you...? Ah, I can sense that you are a powerful Resonator. There's no reason you would lie about such a thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forgive this old man's ramblings. I've been writing a memoir… a record of Ragunna's past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Twenty years ago, the Dark Tide swept through and changed everything. It took too many things and people we held dear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone must write it down, lest the glory and triumphs of our past fade into nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But when I reached the part about Avinoleum, I realized I could barely remember what it looked like.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I… My memories of the seminary are slipping away. The place where I spent my youth, where I strengthened my faith and devoted myself to self-discipline… it's all fading.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was. But as you can see, I no longer wear the vestment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The current Order deems the study of the past forbidden, erasing all past records.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now I have an idea... If you can reach the seminary, could you capture some photos for me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if it has changed greatly, seeing it again might help me recall something... Anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. I've managed to save a little over the years. You won't be doing this for nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Absolutely. I've managed to save a little over the years. You won't be doing this for nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please take this map with you. I... no longer need it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The old man gives you a slightly yellowed map. You find some familiar places depicted on it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This was drawn back when Avinoleum was still on the ground. It marks the renowned places of that time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even now, high in the heavens, I believe some traces of its former beauty remain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you can... take some time to appreciate the sights and enjoy the Ragunna of old.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Hmm? Seems like a special frequency appeared nearby?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The lingering frequency turns into unfamiliar voices around you.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Father… we've arrived? Is this Avinoleum?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Father"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, my dear. We are here at Avinoleum.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Father"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A place blessed by the Sentinel, where divine glory converges—the Avinoleum Theological Seminary.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Father"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From this day forward, you shall study here and grow into an Acolyte strong enough to bear the burden, just as I once did.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Father, are you leaving again?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Father"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry, sweetheart. There are still far-off corners where the Sentinel's blessings have yet to reach. I must continue my duties.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Father"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But know this, I'll return to you whenever you need me.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Something feels familiar...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (It must be that special frequency. What message will it carry this time?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cheers from the crowds fill the air. The banks of the waterway are jammed with people.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ragunna City is always full of cheer and joy at such times, but I never expected to see the same festive spirit at the seminary.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The banks are lined with Acolytes watching the festivities. Even our professors are dancing without a care in the world.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Companion"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the Carnevale, a time to forget all titles and ranks!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right. The Carnevale is when differences and disputes are set aside.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Companion"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, don't just stand there! Come join us! We might even catch a glimpse of the Blessed Maiden herself!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (A hand-drawn map of the seminary? Just like the one I carry.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Perhaps this is not a coincidence.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The Blessed Maiden's coronation? Wait, I sense a Tacet Discord's frequency.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Sloppy?
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Fretful and depressed cry*

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You call this dragon Echo... "Sloppy?"

Dialogues.Speaker: "Senior Female Acolyte"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right. It's known for its gentle, docile nature, loafing around all day. Not that it's shy. It's simply too lazy to move.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May I come closer? I just want to pet it.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, it feels so cold.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Senior Female Acolyte"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha, feel free to spend as much time with it as you like.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And what about that giant dragon over there?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Senior Female Acolyte"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: First time seeing it? That's the Blessed Maiden's mount, Gehinnom. It might look intimidating, but it's actually a gentle soul.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Senior Female Acolyte"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which, the Blessed Maiden's coronation is around the corner.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, I can hardly wait.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to the schedule, the Blessed Maiden will be crowned under the dome soon...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why does the air feel so heavy?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The clamor of the crowd, their panicked shrieks, and an eerie hymn echo all around...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The dark, suffocating fog that's swallowing the sky... Could this be the Dark Tide?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't be tempted by the songs! Run! Beware the Tacet Discords!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now is not the time to surrender. I still see the Blessed Maiden's light shining through. She hasn't given up yet!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My lantern still burns bright, and my sword remains keen enough to fell any evil that dares approach!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The final words of the girl echo in the lingering frequency.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I, Rosalie Seneca, will never succumb to the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, but if luck should spare me one last time, I want to live... I have so many dreams yet to fulfill...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then, silence falls once more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {Male=Sir;Female=Madam}, you just returned from Avinoleum?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Hand him the pictures of the seminary)

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is indeed Avinoleum. These towers, these columns... They still shine with the brilliance of days gone by.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …{Male=Sir;Female=Madam}, there's something I must ask, something I wasn't ready to inquire before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the Dark Tide surged, my daughter, Rosalie, was studying in the seminary. Like so many others there, she vanished from this world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think it's possible that, after all these years, Rosalie still survives in those ruins, isolated from our world?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are instinctively aware of the weight of this question. About that girl's ending...

Options.PlotLineKey: Actually, I encountered her lingering frequencies.
(Keep the truth a secret and remain silent)

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...! Did she say anything? Please, tell me everything you saw and heard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You recount in detail what you saw and heard to the old man before you, her ending included.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The old man's lips quiver ever so slightly. For a long, silent moment, he doesn't speak a word.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was meant to attend the coronation ceremony with her that day, but circumstances delayed me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the time I arrived, it was too late. I couldn't protect my own child as a father, nor could I safeguard the sacred land as an Acolyte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you... for telling me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At least now I know that my daughter died a true Acolyte, her faith unwavering, her soul virtuous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I recall the dusk when I took Rosalie to Avinoleum. The golden light of the setting sun bathed the main tower's dome.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And she asked me who built such a glorious place or if it was a blessing from the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I forgot what I answered, but I believe she found her own answer.

Options.PlotLineKey: It was the work of those before us.
Along with our efforts that built this civilization.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, on the land of Ragunna, such splendor will rise again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I promise, I'll finish this memoir and never let these precious things be lost to time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Until we meet again, {Male=sir;Female=madam}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (You remain silent, fixing your calm gaze on the old man.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Thank you. I believe I already know your answer. That's enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have left a spark of hope lingering in this old, withered heart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I promise, I'll finish this memoir and never let these precious things be lost to time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This long-overdue birthday gift…I know Rosalie would have cherished it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andrea
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Until we meet again, {Male=sir;Female=madam}.
